quote: Okay, let's stand up and be counted: who has been writing diamond graph code? Mine's 60 lines.
author: Barry Rowlingson
context: in a discussion about the patent for diamond graphs

quote: Bug, undocumented behaviour, feature? I dont know. It all seems to work in 1.6.0, so everyone should downgrade now... :)
author: Barry Rowlingson

quote: Robert, I really like you, but you're one of the strangest persons I know.
author: Kurt Hornik
context: in a discussion with Robert Gentleman

quote: I'm always thrilled when people discover what lexical scoping really means.
author: Robert Gentleman

quote: My institution has a particularly diabolical policy on intellectual property, especially on software.
author: Ross Ihaka

quote: If you imagine that this pen is Trellis, then Lattice is not this pen.
author: Paul Murrell
context: on the difference of Lattice (which eventually was called grid) and Trellis

quote: It is good to look around at what is available, but one shouldn't miss what is under one's nose either.
author: Robert Gentleman

quote: What we have is nice, but we need something very different.
author: Robert Gentleman

quote: Readable, obvious, maintainable, 'portable' for some value of 'portable'...
author: Barry Rowlingson

quote: `They' did write documentation that told you that Perl was needed, but `they' can't read it for you.
author: Brian D. Ripley

quote: Overall, SAS is about 11 years behind R and S-Plus in statistical capabilities (last year it was about 10 years behind) in my estimation.
author: Frank Harrell (SAS User, 1969-1991)
Peter Dalgaard
context: in a talk about Tcl/Tk, meaning to say `I want a button widget'

quote: You can be maximally lazy, but still be efficient.
author: Kevin Murphy
context: describing the implementation of an algorithm

quote: Andrew Thomas: ...and if something goes wrong here it is probably not WinBUGS since that has been running for more than 10 years...<x>Peter Green (from the back): ... and it still hasn't converged!
author: Andrew Thomas and Peter Green

quote: This is all documented in TFM. Those who WTFM don't want to have to WTFM again on the mailing list. RTFM.
author: Barry Rowlingson

quote: It really is hard to anticipate just how silly users can be.
author: Brian D. Ripley

quote: So apparently you wish to report as a bug the fact that R 1.8.0 is different from R 1.4.0.
author: Douglas Bates

quote: I plan to fix this - the report is just in case I forget or get hit by a bus.
author: Ross Ihaka
